intro: Platychorda rivalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Platychorda rivalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
